intro: Plagiobothrys acanthocarpus, commonly known as the needlepod fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has linear, needle-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a dry, hairy capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
